comments.author: @jararacain
comments.text:
Fantastic review, Cyrus! I must admit as a Gen 2 owner, initially I was disappointed when I read the specs. But we don't really drive the specs do we. 

I know the Gen 3 got similar hate when it was launched and I recently drove one and felt it wasn't bad at all! And if this one is still a Swift, it's going to be a hoot too. 

I don't think any other car in the Indian market democratised the joy of driving like the Swift. Sure there are, and will be better cars, but as an all round hatchback (driving experience, budget, low maintenance, mileage), few come close.

comments.author: @kushalkuber3383
comments.text: For the price that it is being offered at... It is expensive...the price hike doesn't seem justified when the engine has actually been downgraded interms of number of cylinders, power and refinement. 3 cylinder engines are generally more noisy as compared to 4 cylinders...so the price bracket in which it is offered seems absurd...it should have been atleast 70k cheaper for the base version. One more point i would like to bring up is the previous generation swifts brakes lacked byte and feedback...hope they have fixed it. Also i think if any person needs 360 degree camera for such a small sized car then their driving skills are a big question... But i agree with cyrus that at this price these features should have been offered. I think they should have introduced the 1 litre booster jet in this.. Then it would have been a different animal altogether.

videos.transcript: Did you know that the Marauti Suzuki Swift consistently ranks in the top 10 selling cars in the country, finding over 14,000 new homes month after month? So, what is driving this demand? Is it the allnew petrol engine with its tall fuel efficiency claims, the modern features, or is it simply the enduring appeal of the Swift name plate? Well, we've lived with the car for a few months now to find out. [Music] What? The Swift carries forward its unmistakable silhouette, but now it gets softer, rounder design elements. Now, personally, I quite like its styling, and this red metallic paint shade really complements its youthful character. Here's a fun fact. Despite being significantly larger than the first gen Swift, this one is 90 kg lighter, tipping the scales at 920 kg. The all black interior with hard plastics and a lack of soft touch materials gives a very basic budget feel. Even the freestanding touchscreen is a bit of a letdown. Not only does it lack flare, but it also hampers frontal visibility in certain situations. While the screen covers all the basics and also supports wireless Android Auto, the sound system leaves a lot to be desired. A richer sounding audio experience would have really elevated the drive experience, something that Tata offers with its hatchbacks. The analog dials are clear and very easy to read with premium looking needles. However, the previous version's hooded dials with vertical needles and red accents added a more special and a sportier touch. What you also get is a colored multi-information display, which also features Google Maps prompts. This feature, however, cannot be turned off, and that could be an annoyance to some users. The front seats are sporty and supportive with great side bolstering. As is a typical Japanese car, ergonomics are spot-on with everything falling to hand very naturally. I really like the flat bottom steering wheel. It feels great to hold and even the pedals are well spaced out. And the best thing is you get a proper dead pedal which is very useful on those long drives. And speaking of long drives, the absence of an armrest is noticeable and missed. There's sufficient space for two sixfooters to sit one behind the other, and the rear bench itself is quite comfortable. The repositioned door handles have enabled a wider glass area, including a larger quarter glass, which enhances the sense of space inside. However, the rear bench isn't as wide as, let's say, a Tata Altra. There's no adjustable headrest for the middle passenger, and the rear AC console juts out a bit, which makes this area best for two adults rather than [Music] three. Another miss is the absence of rear cabin lights, which makes it a bit inconvenient to look for missing items, especially in the dark. Storage areas are well thought of all across the cabin. You get a wireless charging pad. You have dual cup holders in the front. You have reasonably sized door pockets with a bottle holder and then room for some more stuff. And you also get multiple charging provisions, two in the front and two at the rear. The 265 L boot is pretty standard for this segment. And you also get the flexibility of a 60/40 split rear seat. One thing that is a bit of a issue is that the boot lip is quite high, which makes loading and unloading heavy items a bit tricky. The redesigned C-pillar does reduce the blind spot compared to the previous generation. However, you will still have to rely on the camera and the sensors as real world visibility isn't great. And speaking of which, the camera quality leaves a lot to be desired. The 82 horsepower output of this 1.2 L 3-cylinder engine might seem a bit modest on paper, but in the real world, it does a reasonable job. In fact, throttle response is crisp. Power delivery is smooth and there's more than enough grunt below 3,000 RPM to keep up with traffic and for daily commuting whether on the city or on the highway. And usually it's the,000 to 3,000 RPM band where most users generally limit India driving to. So yes, when it comes to a commuter engine, this does a reasonable job. One interesting factoid is that the rolling acceleration or the India acceleration types of this Swift are far better than all the generations of the Swift which means drivability is among the best something that users will appreciate. However, for people who value outright acceleration more, that is 0 to 100 km/h, this generation of the Swift is the slowest compared to all the generations, including the first generation Swift. So, yes, enthusiasts looking for the outright punch and that free revving nature from the Swift will be left a bit disappointed. And even the revs max out at 6,000 RPM, that is 300 RPM lower than the previous version, which feels a bit restrictive. But those who want thrilling acceleration from signal to signal, the Swift's engine feels quite peppy up to speeds of 60 km/h, as demonstrated in our drag race, where its slick controls and strong bottom end give it an edge compared to a much more powerful hatchback. And speaking of which, a manual gearbox is not something that I'd usually recommend someone looking for a city commuter, especially if you live in one of the congested metro cities. However, the Swift's 5-speed unit is an exception. The shifts are sleek and buttery smooth in their operation. In fact, even the clutch is very light, which really takes away the effort of rowing through the gears manually. We've consistently recorded fuel efficiency figures of 14 km per liter in the city and up to 19 km per liter on the highway. And while these numbers are impressive, they are nowhere close to Mary's claims of 24.8 km per liter. The steering is smooth and fluid in its operation and a huge improvement compared to the lifeless unit in the third generation. What also adds to the driving ease and the driver confidence is the fact that after you make a U-turn, the steering returns to its center position very naturally. Its ride is slightly on the stiffer side and while it does reasonably well in the city at low speeds, however, at high speeds, body movements can be felt in the car quite sharply. Sure, it might not be as chuckable or as go-kartike as the first gen Swift. However, mechanical grip is commendable, body roll is well contained, and you can have a lot of fun pushing this car around your favorite winding section of road. In fact, this car can easily be categorized as a fun to drive car only if the engine had a bit more zing. Its LED headlamps offer a good throw. However, they aren't spread too wide. So, on a winding road, you could find illumination a bit lacking. Since our long-termer has done only 10,000 km, the service cost is estimated to be rupees 1,600 for changing the oil and oil filter. Marauti provides three free services in the first year. Hence, there won't be any labor cost for this 10,000 km service. The Maruti Swift remains a practical fuelefficient hatchback that retains its fun to drive character. Yes, its engine feels a bit out of place on the highway, but in the city it feels reasonably peppy. After spending so many months with the car, we've really grown fond of it. And quite honestly, I think it's one of the most charming Maruti hatchbacks on sale today. [Music]

If my wife drives it, she gets around 12 km/l. Why didn‚Äôt they think about CNG? Who wants to stand in lines for CNG, brother? I'm 45, and I've spent almost one-third of my life in this car. Why does the Swift sell so well in the Indian market? If I were to answer that, you might not find it convincing, but let me introduce you to someone. This is Gaurav Chaudhary. How are you, Gaurav Chaudhary? Welcome to our channel. Happy 26! Thank you so much! So, you've been driving the Swift since 2009, and this is the latest Swift. How many times have you changed your Swift since 2009? This is the third one. So, what‚Äôs the reason for your love for the Swift? Of course, it‚Äôs Maruti's trust, which is constant. That‚Äôs the biggest thing. Also, in the city we live in, Ghaziabad, the traffic volume is increasing a lot. So, for local commuting in traffic, this is the best option. We didn‚Äôt upgrade to the model that came in between because I personally didn‚Äôt like the rear handle that moved to the quarter panel. As soon as they changed it, I bought this one. Have you ever driven it in diesel? I have always driven the diesel version; this is my first petrol car with a three-cylinder engine. So, which variant did you choose? I took the LXI variant because I wanted it, but I have converted it completely. I have updated all the best accessories in it. So, you took the base model and made it top-spec? Almost around 2 lakh has been invested in it. Oh, you‚Äôre saying 2 lakh as an investment? Why do you call it an investment? An investment means, of course, that when I liquidate it, I will get better value for it. It sells for around the same value as the top model. So, how much did you buy it for? It cost around 7.25 lakhs. And how much have you driven it so far? It has run around 27,000-28,000 km in 19 months. So, in 19 months, Gaurav has driven around 27,000-28,000 km, and today in our customer review, we will tell you why people like the Swift and why Gaurav is so crazy about it. Does he drive any other car? No, he doesn‚Äôt. How much mileage is he getting? Let‚Äôs talk about comfort; how satisfied is he? Also, when he goes for servicing, how happy does he feel? He will also tell us why you should buy the Swift. You will find the answer to that in this video. So, let‚Äôs get started and give you a detailed customer review of the Swift because after the three-cylinder engine, people have been talking a lot about this car. They feel that it won‚Äôt be justified with a three-cylinder engine. But I have the right person who will answer that correctly. So, let‚Äôs begin, and we will tell you all about this car in detail, and through a great customer review, all your doubts will be cleared. So, Gaurav, let‚Äôs start with your engine. When we talk about performance, it has a three-cylinder engine. Yes, it has insulation plates, etc. But I had many doubts about the three-cylinder engine because, of course, a three-cylinder cannot match the pickup of what the diesel used to give. But if I talk about petrol, it‚Äôs a very smooth and silent kind of car. So, when we talk about performance on the highway, when you overtake, it‚Äôs fine. There‚Äôs no issue. I drive it hard because I also drive a Duster. I don‚Äôt drive slowly at all. I‚Äôm not a rash driver, but I don‚Äôt drive slow. I have pushed it up to 100-120 km/h. At 120, it creates a bit of a problem, but generally, for a city ride at 90-100, it‚Äôs okay because I‚Äôm expecting some of my new cars. That‚Äôs why I drive it regularly. I take it to Gurgaon and Vadgaon quite often. It gives me a good driving pleasure. When it comes to servicing, how is it? How many services have you done? The difference is that when my other cars have any problems, I drop everything and go for servicing first. In this, it costs around ‚Çπ2500-5000 for servicing. Yes, yes. So, it runs almost like a free car. It has a three-cylinder engine. Yes, they did this to increase mileage. Do you think the mileage has improved? What‚Äôs your overall mileage? The company claims 25 km/l, but I think 25 is a very idealistic scenario that I have never achieved. Generally, I get a mileage of 16-17-18 km/l. If I drive, it gives me 17-18. If my wife drives, she gets around 12. Her driving capacity is such that she gets single-digit mileage in every car. But generally, from a female to a male driver, when I‚Äôm driving, I try to drive it smoothly, and it gives me 16-17 km/l. Safety is a big concern. Let‚Äôs stop it. It feels alright. When it comes to safety, how safe do you feel in this car? Safety matters, but let me tell you, it‚Äôs not solving any specific purpose for me that I need to take long drives in it. It runs around 40-50 km per day. Every day, it goes around 40-50 km. It drops my kids at the bus stop and picks them up. My daughter goes to her class, and my son goes to his academy. This is what it does for 40-50 km. I haven‚Äôt taken it on any long trips. The longest trip has been 70 km. I haven‚Äôt gone 100 km in one shot. But it has done many trips to Gurgaon. There‚Äôs no hidden challenge regarding safety or maintenance because of the three-cylinder engine. If we talk about the headlamp throw, how is it? Every headlamp costs around ‚Çπ12,000, which I have replaced. It has high beam headlamps. Where you live in Ghaziabad, potholes are common, but the situation has improved a lot. Still, when bad roads come, do you think the approach angle is fine? There hasn‚Äôt been any issue where it got stuck or anything happened because the ground clearance is quite good. We have sorted all those things. If we talk about the side, you have upgraded the tire size a bit. Yes, it‚Äôs not too much. You‚Äôve been driving the same format since 2009. The tire size is 195/60 R15. It has 15-inch alloys. Only the patterns change a bit, but the tire size and everything remain the same. So, I haven‚Äôt faced any distraction in mileage, nor have I compromised on anything. It has the same pickup and mileage as before. The base model has defoggers. You haven‚Äôt done much at the rear. I haven‚Äôt done much at the rear. I have replaced the tires, the interior, and the lamps, and I have installed a shark fin antenna. Did you install a camera? Yes, it has a rear parking camera and everything. If we talk about the boot, do you think it‚Äôs convenient for storing stuff? Because my main purpose was to fit my son‚Äôs cricket kit in it. It fits his kit and a couple of his friends‚Äô kits when he goes to the academy. So, it can accommodate basic bags and stuff. I think it has around 250 liters of boot space. It‚Äôs not too little. There‚Äôs no issue with that. I can‚Äôt comment much on it because my agenda to buy this car was never about carrying stuff. It was more for city travel, which is giving me 10 out of 10 marks. It‚Äôs a car that works like a bike for you. It‚Äôs perfect for local use. But I have a different passion for cars, so I have modified it in an amazing way. Let‚Äôs go check out the interior. So, Gaurav, I want to know how comfortable the rear seat is. I know you‚Äôve spent a lot of time in the rear seat. By chance, through your channel, I‚Äôm sitting in the back for the first time. I haven‚Äôt sat in it until now. But it‚Äôs quite comfortable with four people sitting in it, and both of us are around 6 feet tall, so there‚Äôs no problem. There‚Äôs enough space for a bottle holder. A big bottle fits in the front seat, but a small one, like a 1-liter bottle, fits in the middle compartment holder along with the gear. The AC works well; there‚Äôs no issue with it. Fortunately, we live in a climate where temperatures go up to 52¬∞C. So, there‚Äôs no problem with the AC performance. From a performance perspective, there‚Äôs nothing wrong. If we talk about interior modifications, what have you done? The interior modifications are quite simple. If you see, I have moved the bucket seats. The cabin light was yellow, and I changed it to white. The music system that comes with it doesn‚Äôt come standard, but I installed an 11-inch aftermarket music system. I have tried to install the best within my capacity. Let‚Äôs take a look at your car from the front. It doesn‚Äôt look like a base model Swift at all. There are many changes you‚Äôve made. The music system shows Android Auto, Apple CarPlay, and everything. The reverse parking camera offers decent quality too. The bucket seats you installed look great. One thing I want to ask is why did you choose manual? I chose manual because at that time, I had a finite budget. My purpose for this car was more for local city use. When I was going for the automatic, my budget was getting overshot. So, I thought about it, and when I saw this, the manual was running very smoothly. Plus, my daughter is in class 12, so I wanted her to learn to drive on a manual for some time before moving to an automatic. Those were my specific reasons. If we talk about utility space in this car, it has enough space for small items. You can see the bottle in front. In fact, I think it has better space for keeping mobile phones than the Thar. You also have space in the glove box. So, there are no complaints about that. If there‚Äôs any complaint about this car, it‚Äôs just that if Maruti had ideally kept a four-cylinder engine, it would have had better pickup. And Maruti shouldn‚Äôt have discontinued the diesel engine so quickly because that was their hot-selling cake from a diesel engine perspective. But specifically from the car perspective, it‚Äôs absolutely fine. Why didn‚Äôt they think about CNG? Who wants to stand in lines for CNG, brother? It wouldn‚Äôt feel good. There‚Äôs no need for it. There‚Äôs not enough of a problem that I would go for it because it‚Äôs giving good mileage. If you had to choose another car instead of this one, what would it be? Was there anything else in mind, or was it just this? I didn‚Äôt consider anything else. We were very clear. We didn‚Äôt look at many options. Tata‚Äôs PCh or if I talk about the segment under 10 lakhs, there were multiple options, but we never considered them because it was very clear that if I wanted an option under 10 lakhs, it had to be only Maruti Swift. That‚Äôs it. Especially my concern was that the rear handle on the quarter panel that moved to the rear door was absolutely fine, so there was no question of looking at something else. When I talk about my car selection, I took the Tata Harrier because it offers better space than any other. What about the value you got for the cars you sold? I want to understand the resale because Maruti‚Äôs resale is still considered the best. When I actually sold my Swift, I got a very good resale value. I think I sold it around 5-6 years ago. In comparison, if I talk about the two cars I liquidated, which are my Duster and my other car, I am very disappointed. I will use that right terminology; I am very disappointed because both cars cost me approximately ‚Çπ32 lakhs new, and now they are worth around 10 lakhs together. So, in six years, if I had invested ‚Çπ32 lakhs in the market or real estate, it would have multiplied three to four times, and technically, I lost 20% on that ‚Çπ32 lakhs. Whereas if it were Maruti or Hyundai Creta, it might have given me better resale value. Tata and Renault need to work strongly on why their market value is poor despite having such good products. Regarding resale, it‚Äôs important to keep in mind that when you go to buy a car, you should also think about what resale value you will get. Because one day you might want to change your car, and if it doesn‚Äôt hold value, it‚Äôs very disappointing. You can imagine that against ‚Çπ32 lakhs, if someone gets 10 lakhs, that‚Äôs a loss of 67%. You should think about whether you would want to lose ‚Çπ67 out of every ‚Çπ100. I have lived that moment. It‚Äôs very risky. Whenever you buy a car, you should always go for a product whose market value and resale liquidation are better compared to whatever is out there in the market. Keep in mind that Maruti Suzuki has a market share of over 42% in India. All other car companies operate in the remaining share. You can gauge from that. So, let‚Äôs wrap up this conversation with Gaurav. Gaurav chose to buy a base model car for ‚Çπ7 lakhs, which would have cost ‚Çπ7.5 lakhs if he went for the top variant. But he invested in this and you have already seen the investment on our channel. I think it‚Äôs a good thing if you don‚Äôt make unethical modifications. He upgraded the tire size by one inch. If you look at the other changes, they are quite justified. It‚Äôs not that there has been any wire cutting or anything. I always consider such modifications bad, and he hasn‚Äôt tampered with the structure either. So, what he has experienced with this car, I have shared with you. Before we finish, Gaurav, why would you suggest buying the Swift? Look, if you are looking for a mid-segment car under ‚Çπ10 lakhs, there‚Äôs no better option than this. Because it gives very good mileage. It gives around 16-17 km/l. It‚Äôs easy to maintain. The best part is that it‚Äôs easy to handle. I already have other cars too. The reason was very specific because we needed it for local city commuting, for which it‚Äôs perfect, 10 out of 10. I have been driving it since 2009, and in 2025, it will be almost 16 years, which is a significant part of my life. I‚Äôm 45, so I‚Äôve spent almost one-third of my life in this car. It‚Äôs a complete value for money. Even with minor modifications, it provides very good comfort. That‚Äôs why it gets 10 out of 10 marks in my life because my other cars, if I may take the names, are the Renault Duster and the Tata Harrier, which I am very fond of. But they have caused me a lot of loss when I liquidated them, which makes my affection for this car grow even more. The resale value of this car, commercially, is more effective compared to other brands like Tata and Renault. So, it‚Äôs even closer to my heart. Modifications can also be an investment if done correctly. And why does the Swift sell so much? I think Gaurav has clarified all these points. Why is Gaurav happy? Why does he trust it so much? Why is it a boon for city commuting? He has explained everything in this video. Let us know how you found this video, and if you drive a Swift, why do you like it? Please share your thoughts in the comments. And if you want to meet me, just send a message on our Instagram, Power On Wheels. We will come to meet you and share your story on our channel.

videos.transcript:
Hello, I am Main. In today's video, we will discuss in detail the most value-for-money variant of the Maruti Suzuki Swift, which comes under the name VXI Optional. The Swift has a total of five variants: LXI, VXI, VXI Optional, ZXI, and finally ZXI Plus. Right now, we have the mid variant, which is the VXI Optional. This variant is just above the VXI and offers significantly better features. Logically speaking, if you switch from VXI to VXI Optional, you will need to pay approximately ‚Çπ35,000 to ‚Çπ40,000 extra. This means that the VXI Optional is ‚Çπ400 more expensive than the VXI. For that ‚Çπ400, you will get a lot of new features. Additionally, this variant also offers the option of Suzuki Connect. In this video, we will discuss the features you get, the price, and how it has changed with the new GST rates this year, along with any offers available. Let's clarify everything in this video. 

First, let's start with the key. The VXI Optional comes with a smart key, which is quite nice. The back has the Suzuki logo. At the front, you get two buttons for locking and unlocking, complete with sound. From the front, the Swift looks quite appealing. You will find a ground clearance of 163 mm. The front features a gloss-finish grille. You can attach the number plate here. The Suzuki logo is now placed here. The headlights are projector-based, producing both high and low beams. You will find a yellow light setup here for your parking lights, and the side indicators are also present. There are no DRLs available, just some chrome accents. Fog lights are also not included in this variant, but you can add them as accessories. The bonnet looks like this, with two washers provided. The windshield is quite large. 

Now, regarding the price, this particular variant is priced at approximately ‚Çπ6,84,900. Currently, I am at Hindustan Auto Agency, which is available in Hazaribagh, Jharkhand. Here, the on-road cost is approximately ‚Çπ7,76,000. The prices I am mentioning are the latest. Previously, there was a price difference of about ‚Çπ10,000 this year. This means that the car has become more expensive than before, and regarding offers, you can expect a cash discount of up to ‚Çπ20,000 on this car. 

Now, if we talk about the side profile, the Swift looks quite premium. The tires in this variant come with black steel rims from MRF. The profile is 165/80 R14 inches. You get tubeless tires here, with disc brakes at the front and drum brakes at the rear. The side mirrors are fully body-colored with side turn indicators. The B-pillar is in matte black. From the back, the Swift looks quite attractive with its tail lights. The main parking light is LED, and you also get an LED main brake light. The reverse light comes with a bulb unit, along with the side indicator light. The reverse section only has parking sensors provided; you do not get a camera, but you can install it as an accessory. Inside, you can see that you get a touchscreen music system. The camera can also be added as an accessory. Here, you will find the Suzuki logo and branding for Swift. You only get a defogger here, and there is no washer. The good thing is that you have a high-speed shop lamp and a regular antenna. You can fill fuel from the left side, which has a capacity of 37 liters and supports petrol A20. 

Let's open the boot. To open the boot, you have a magnetic button and a request sensor. Here, you get a boot space of 265 liters, which is quite good. You also have five trays available. You will not find any boot light here, but there is space to install one as an accessory. The spare tire is a steel rim with the same profile as the tires outside, so there is no cost-cutting in that regard. 

Now that we have covered the exterior features and price differences, let's move on to the interior and see what features are available there. Starting with the passenger side door handle, you will find a body-colored door handle. The interior trim is in matte black, which looks quite good. There is a little space available here. You get power windows at the back, and the door lock button and speaker are chrome-finished. The seat color is all black, providing good comfort. You will find a bench-type seat in this variant, and there are no 60:40 split seats available. Integrated headrests are provided. For safety purposes, fabric seats are provided everywhere, which are quite comfortable. The seat length is also decent. You will find ISOFIX points in both seats. 

Moving inside, you will find decent legroom and thigh support. The driver‚Äôs seat does not have a pocket behind it, but the co-driver's seat has a small pocket. In the center, you have a bottle holder. There is a slight hump, but three people can sit comfortably here due to the good seat length. The dashboard looks quite attractive from the back. You will find front lights here, but no lights in the back. You only get a single regular bulb light. You have three grab handles, and you will also find curtain airbags on the sides. All variants of the Swift come standard with six airbags, ABS, EBD, traction control, etc. 

Now, let's check out the front row and see what features are available there. Starting with the driver side door handle, you will find a body-colored door handle with a request sensor. You can also unlock the car using the key. You have three request sensors available: one on the driver side, one on the co-driver side, and one in the boot. The interior trim is similar to the passenger side door, in matte black. The good thing is that you get fabric soft touch here, which is also available on both the driver and co-driver sides. You will find the door handle here, and you have controls for all four power windows. The good thing is that you get one-touch down and up for the mirrors. The lock/unlock button is available here. The side door mirrors are electrically adjustable and foldable. You also have chrome accents for the door opener, lock button, speaker, and bottle holder. 

The dashboard looks quite attractive. The driver‚Äôs seat only has back adjustment. The front seats are quite comfortable, providing good shoulder support. If you sit in this seat, it will hold you well, offering great comfort. The texture is quite nice. The front seats also have adjustable headrests and airbags. You will find the engine start/stop button here, along with the traction control on/off button and the idle start/stop on/off button. You can adjust the headlights from here. Below, you have the fuel opener and front bonnet opener. The three pedals are also present, including a dead pedal. 

After entering, the dashboard looks quite good. Starting with the steering, you will find a flat bottom steering wheel that can only be adjusted up and down. You cannot adjust it forward and backward. The steering has the Suzuki logo in the center, and you will find one airbag here. On the left side of the steering, you have controls for telephony, and on the right side, you have controls for the headlights and wipers. This is the semi-digital meter console. On the left side, you have the tachometer, and on the right side, you have the speedometer. You will find a display showing the rear seat belt reminder and which door is open. You also have the time, odometer, and fuel gauge displayed. There are two buttons; with the right button, you can check the average range, and with the left button, you can check trip A, trip B, and the odometer. 

This is the music system, which supports wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. It comes with Bluetooth, FM, radio, USB, etc. You will find a great music system here with good touch response, and it is feature-loaded. This variant also offers the option of Suzuki Connect, through which you can track any issues with the car or monitor it. Additionally, you can view vehicle alerts and main warning alerts through this music system. It also supports Bluetooth voice commands. If you install a back camera, you can do so as an accessory. You will find matte finishing on the sides, and the hazard switch is available here. You have four AC vents in the front, and this variant comes with manual climate control. The good thing is that you have a max AC button here for quickly cooling the cabin. Below, you have a 12-volt charging socket and a USB socket, along with a little space. You have two cup holders here. This is the gear knob, a five-speed gear with one reverse. You will find a good gear knob here, along with a handbrake. 

Regarding glove box space, you will find decent space there as well. One airbag is also provided here. In the center, you have a day-night manual rearview mirror. Regular bulb lights are available here. On the driver side sun visor, you will find a mirror, and on the driver side, you also get a ticket holder. 

So that was the exterior and interior features of the Swift's most value-for-money variant, the VXI Optional. What do you think of all these features? Please comment below. Now, let's talk about the engine section of this car. After opening the front bonnet, it looks like this. You will find engine insulation here, along with an engine guard. The battery is from Exide. 

Regarding the engine, it comes with a 1.2L Jet Series three-cylinder petrol engine that generates 80 bhp of power and 111 Nm of torque. You will find a good power figure here. Although the power figure might seem a bit low, the mileage is quite good. Speaking of mileage, it will give you between 20 and 25 km/l combined in the city and on the highway. 

What do you think of this car and this video? Please comment below. If you are also planning to check out a value-for-money variant of the Swift, do consider the VXI Optional, as it is the king in its segment. You get so many features in it. If you are new to the channel, please subscribe before you leave. See you in the next video. Until then, keep watching and stay safe.

videos.transcript: Hey guys! Welcome to MotorOctane. How are you all today? Today I am very excited because I have brought a car review for you which we have thought that this is my dream car. Right? At some point of time, many of us thought that we should buy or drive a Swift once in our life. So today Maruti has launched a new generation Swift here. We have already brought its walkaround for you. Today we will talk about its review. Now let's see this car. This is a 4th generation Swift. Many changes have been made to it overall. Although, not much has been changed in its platform. But still, the weight of this car has increased by 20-25 kgs Depending on which variant you are looking at. If I tell you simply, if you look at its styling from the front, there is not much change in the car. There are small changes but the idea is that if you look at the first Swift, the first Swift of 2005 and today's Swift of 2024, then there should not be much change in the design. It should look like yes, it is a Swift family. So somewhere the styling of the headlamps is the same. But now it comes with projector LEDs, with daytime running LEDs. Your fog lamps are given LEDs. So overall, all the white lights come on the top model. Small changes have been made to its grille design. And along with that, the logo that used to come in the middle on the grille, has now been taken on top. Bonnet has been made a little smaller. So overall, small changes have been made to the design elements in the car. The biggest change on the car is the fact that now its engine has been shifted from 4-cylinder to 3-cylinder. I will tell you the details when I drive the car. But if I say in one line, Maruti says that we have done this to improve the fuel efficiency of this car. By the way, if you want to increase the mileage of your Car without compromising on its performance, then I recommend Total Energies Quartz 9000 Extra Engine Oil. Now this is a completely fully synthetic engine oil. And this comes with the latest eco-science technology, which increases the life of your engine. By the way, do you know that the start-stop system has become very common in cars these days? It also comes in Swift, right? So what does this do? It affects the life of your engine somewhere. In such a time, Quartz Engine Oil not only protects your engine, but also further enhances its life. In short, if I say, your expenses are reduced. By the way, to purchase this, I am leaving the Amazon link for you in the description. When we look at the side profile of this car, it looks like the existing Swift to a great extent. The ground clearance has not changed much, but our experience has been pretty good. The car has 15-inch wheels on the higher variants, and 14-inch wheels on the lower variants. And in the top-end model, you get alloy wheels. Okay, so you have disc brakes on the front, and drum brakes on the rear. Many people will criticize that disc brakes should be everywhere in this car, but it is not possible to do it at this price point. Maruti Should get Credit for not doing any Cost-cut For example, If I Talk about Passive door entry In this, you get both sides Left Right Both Sides you get Passive door entry which is a good thing about it. So overall, The rear styling is also similar to that of the car. LED tail lamps are present. One thing that I find off is that the big camera given by Suzuki to the people below, again, that could have been designed a little better. Now, Maruti has not cost-cut one more place, which is that it has four rear sensors. Mostly, what will the automakers do? They will give two in the front and two in the back, and will say that we have both types. Now, if we talk about its boot space, then the boot space of 265 litres is decent enough. It's not like really huge or very small. Maruti being smart, they have made the spare tyre a little thinner and smaller here, so that the boot space is also increased and their cost is also reduced overall. So the boot space is decent enough. There is also a light at the back. And to increase the boot space, a 60-40 split has also been made available. These are a lot of exterior things. Let's step into the car. Like the exterior of Swift, not a lot of changes have been made to the interior of the car. All the panels and everything must have been changed in the car, but you won't feel like this car is very different in look. We'll get into all of that. But first, let's understand, you get majorly hard plastics in this car. In this category, you get hard plastics in most cars. The fit and finish of the car is good. There is no shortage of touch and feel of materials. The materials are good. But if I talk about the design, then small changes have been made. Earlier, you used to get Swift in the touchscreen centre. Now, they have taken it up. They have given it a tablet-like look here. But we have experienced this screen in Maruti's other cars as well. The good thing is, for Swift, you get screens like this in the cars above this. Baleno, Ciaz, Brezza, Vitara, all of them have this screen. Which means, this screen is now available on the lower end as well, on a product like Swift. It's a 9-inch screen. There is no problem in usability. It's quite easy to operate. It has wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. It also has reverse parking cameras, whose quality is decent enough overall. And you also get wireless mobile phone charging in this car. Now, Maruti's connected tech, it's called Suzuki Connect, has been offered in Swift as well. Which means, you get connected technology in the higher variant Swift. The instrument cluster is quite simple and basic. I feel, it should have been digital. And the middle elements, like torque and power, which we saw in Baleno in 2015, the car is completely black. Even then, the cabin doesn't feel tight or cramped. Because the roof area is completely light in colour. Apart from this, the steering wheel has leather wrap on the higher variant. You will even get leather wrap on the gear lever, on the manual version. Whereas, if I talk about the front seats, there is no major difference between the previous and current seats. The seats are soft and cushiony. The side support is also good. And overall, it's a very nice and comfortable seat to be on. I feel, the seats that Maruti upgraded in 2014-15, starting from the Baleno, the same type of seats are continuing today. Minor tweaking is done in Baleno and Brezza, but they are very nice and comfortable. So, this is a good thing. Swift has always been a feature-rich car. And the same is continuing in the current car as well. I share all the list of features with you. But, there are still a few things missing in this. So, for example, you don't get an auto day and night mirror here. Yes, the rear AC vents are now available. And you also get a USB and Type-C charging port in the back. So, there is a slight increase in features. But, if this car is coming at the price of Baleno, then it could have features like a 360 camera. In terms of safety features, there are a lot of new features in this car. The base variant has 6 airbags, which is ESC standard. Which means, the things that were missing in this car, for safety, entry-level variant, have now been introduced here. One thing that I find a little off in this car, is the door. See, if I open the door. Okay. So, if I do it a little slowly, it's not closing. There is a little effort in it. I still remember when the Baleno facelift came, Brezza facelift came, they improved its quality. And the sheet metal, even if I pressed it, it used to get stuck. Now, it's not getting stuck from the outside. Now, my height is 6 feet. And I'm adjusting the front seat, according to my driving seating position. I'm coming at the back now. The door opens wide for the car. So, getting in and out is quite comfortable. You can easily get in the car. You'll sit. But you'll notice that, overall, if a person like me sits in the back, they don't have a lot of knee room. So, tall passengers, if they sit in the front and back, it'll be a little tight for them. The seat is wide. The width of the car is good. So, there shouldn't be a problem for three people to sit in. Unless it's very tight. But, it's a nice and wide car. So, that's a good thing. Now, the car is wide. It's made for three people to sit in. So, there's a three-point seat belt for everyone. But, there's no headrest for the third passenger. I think, a lot of brands have a problem with visibility. But, at least, give a fixed headrest. At least, so that the third passenger can get some comfort if they sit in the middle. For those who sit in the middle, the problem is that, the AC vents are further back. Earlier, the AC vents didn't come. Now, the AC vents are further back. Overall, the centre tunnel is a little high. So, the person sitting in the middle won't enjoy sitting here. The recline of the seat is good. I don't have any complaints there. Overall, the headroom is good. But, the thigh support could've been better. Now, what Maruti has done is, the pockets behind the seat have been removed from here. But, they've given it on this side, on the left side. And, they've given it quite low. So, I'm not sure if there's anything other than the phone. Overall, the glass area in the car is quite good. Now, because it's a sporty car, there's not a lot of glass area in it. And, my only complaint is, where's the UV-cut glass? And, the passengers sitting in the back, they don't have any light in the cabin. It's only one light in the front. There's no light option in the back. So, I think that's a miss-out. But, like I said, the biggest change on the car is the engine. Now, it's time to drive it and I'm going to tell you, how good does it drive? So, let's go. So, now it's time to drive the Swift. I've started the car. Let's slow down the AC a bit. And, here we go. Let's rev the car a bit. The car goes up to 6000 RPM. Free flowing. Quite smooth. Okay, let's start talking about it. It has a 1.2 litre petrol engine Earlier it was a 4 cylinder, now it's a 3 cylinder So it's technically a brand new engine which Maruti has introduced I'll talk of everything here Right now, it only comes with petrol, 5-speed manual a 5 speed AMT There's no CNG on offer at the moment Eventually, CNG will be introduced In the future, they will introduce hybrid as well For better fuel efficiency Okay, so let's understand the engine It has a 1.2 litre engine If I go by the number, the power has reduced I'm not getting into that 10% power has been reduced It used to be 88 bhp, now it's around 80-82 bhp So 8-10% power has been reduced But does it affect the reality? No, it doesn't make a difference It's quite smooth to drive If you have power, if you want to overtake in the city or on the highway No problem, you can do that with a lot of ease So, what has been changed in the car? What has been changed in the engine? The first big change is that Earlier the engine was very free flowing I mean, press the accelerator And the engine was like waiting I want to go, I'm waiting, I'm waiting I want to go faster So, in that way, the engine was very free revving Now, that character has been reduced The free revving has been reduced somewhere Even now, the engine is free revving It is still one of the best 1.2 litre petrol engines in the category But the revving nature of a 4-cylinder engine It's shorter stroke, smaller in size, piston So, it revs well It's a bit technical for you But that is where the clear differentiation happened Now, is there a vibration in a 3-cylinder engine? Well, to a great extent, there isn't Because Maruti has already mastered it With the 1 litre Celerio, WagonR, Alto K10 So, they have already mastered the 3-cylinder technology to a great extent But when your car is static, not moving at all The engine is running And then, you will feel a slight vibration Yes, there are some vibrations in the car But when the door of the car is open That's when you start feeling a lot of vibration But apart from that, there is no such complaint You don't really hear a lot of noise The exhaust note has changed a bit If you listen to the exhaust Earlier, there was a sweet sound Now, there is a throaty noise So, that's what the Japanese engines used to be I don't feel that much in this It seems this has been made but not for real fun Sort-of a Drive Now, if I talk about this engine And I talk of the connection with the new buyers If a person is buying a Swift for the first time With the thought that I have heard about the Swift brand It's a good brand Let me buy this engine He or She will not miss the Older Engine They will not miss the engine Because they are getting all the power Now, if I talk about the other aspects of this car I have nothing to complain about The ride quality, the bad roads I drove I have no complaints There is no concern about handling The steering wheel is light You will drive in the city for a full day You won't get tired The feedback is recent enough There is no such complaint on the car If I put it up The important thing in the car is If you sit high, you won't see the edges of the bonnet The mirror size could me push the car And I have been pushing I am driving 100, 120, 140 Now, when I am talking to you I am constantly driving between 70 and 90 So, overall I am still getting a mileage of 15 to 16 Which is fantastic Now, how does the AMT perform? So, AMT being AMT If you press the accelerator hard It will show you that the gear has shifted It has gone from 5th to 3rd But, actually it takes a little time Compared to a regular automatic gearbox So, AMT is much better than most of the other cars But, yes, AMT cannot be the best I mean, it's like AMT has the best gearbox But, just that In front of a normal automatic It feels a little weak And, its gear shifts in Tiptronic That is quite good And you get a good response in that So, if you really want to shift gears quickly You can rely on the Tiptronic technology Especially, if you want to shift 1 or 2 gears up and down Apart from that, just push it down It will change From 5th to 2nd gear Our car has come many times So, there is absolutely no problem with it Yes, its gear shifts are very fast Which will increase the overall fuel efficiency of the car And that's what this engine has been made for This gearbox has been made That we will shift gears quickly So, you will reach the 5th gear at a speed of 40-50 If you don't press the accelerator too much Now, I haven't completely tested the music system of this Car I have experienced it But, I can tell you It sounds really good I depth in music But, if you want to listen to loud music You will like it So, if we talk about the safety Maruti has worked on it But, the Global NCAP score has not come yet Now, we won't get to see has recently released a teaser Where they said that they are going to bring results of other cars And, there was a photo of this car in it So, because of this I feel There could be something coming up videos.transcript: Four generations, 20 years, and countless stories. This vehicle is not just a hatchback; it is India's default setting. [Music] [Music] [Music] Because some things never get old. Like a sip of hot tea, [Music] songs sung by Kishore Da, and the Maruti Suzuki Swift [Music] and today we will journey from its origin to its legacy in this episode of Past Forward. [Music] [Music] [Music] In 2005, Maruti Suzuki, which we will refer to simply as Maruti throughout the video, was painted with a sensible uncle image. But with the first-gen Swift, the attack happened suddenly. I mean, the uncle had pulled his shirt out and made a grand entry at the party. [Music] Low roof, chunky hips, airy design, and big [Music] uncomfortable seats. India saw for the first time that affordability and attitude can go [Music] hand in hand. The Swift was a project where [Music] engineers from India and Japan sat together from concept S to final completion. And the result was a global Suzuki but at heart [Music] an Indian Maruti. [Music] Initially, the Swift was offered only with [Music] a petrol engine. Its somewhat taut suspension and balanced handling earned it the title of a fun-to-drive car. And in 2007, when India was falling in love with diesel, the DDIS made its entry, the Fiat-sourced 1.3 L Multijet engine. Affectionately referred to as India's national engine. A bit of lag, a thump in the mid-range, and [Music] suddenly, the Swift became the people's budget hot hatch. From taxi drivers to [Music] enthusiasts, everyone was happy. Because fuel bills were low and smiles were wide. And this little god's 2010 update was compliant with BS4 emission norms. But here began a small conflict between feel versus comfort. Because some rawness from the steering was lost and the suspension became a bit softer. Hyundai was getting premium and refined but [Music] for some people, a little too sober. The Swift had the space but not the spark. And the promise of the Swift was simple. I‚Äôm fast. [Music] I‚Äôm fun and you can definitely take me home to your parents because they will love me. In 2011, the sequel arrived. Almost the same in appearance but everything under the skin was new. [Music] [Music] Better fuel efficiency with VVT, a tighter chassis, longer wheelbase, lighter body, and a nicer cabin. Maruti polished its cult and those who said it would just be a facelift were silenced by its drive. [Music] The petrol carried forward the 1.2K series now with [Music] VVT and the diesel also remained the same. The 1.3 DDIS. The 2014 facelift brought minor design updates and the company's confidence was high, and Maruti's product planning was maturing. [Music] Maruti touched up the core of the Swift [Music] not reinventing it. India wanted the same fun. Just improve NVH, give mileage, and make the interiors feel good. Rivals like the Brio came but the Swift stood tall with confidence [Music] and an engine lineup that just worked. [Music] In 2018, Maruti gave the third generation Swift a new diet with the new heart platform. [Music] [Music] Engine options remained the same with both petrol and diesel being offered with the same configuration and output as earlier. This particular 2020 LXI variant is petrol. So, to make this lovely rascal your own, call the number above. And with Cast 24's new 30-day return policy, we‚Äôve got you covered for a hassle-free decision. And for the first time, Maruti introduced the AGS and AMT transmission in the Swift, meaning convenience for the masses, and there‚Äôs still a manual for enthusiasts. Maintain the balance. But 2020 came and BS6 emission norms said diesel would become expensive. So, Maruti closed the entire chapter on diesel. The mood of the story changed to Swift. Swift remained a petrol-only car. But it was about to get a lot smarter. Because the 2021 facelift brought a switch with a refreshed engine with dual jet and dual VVT. The third-gen Swift is the car where you don‚Äôt stop at the petrol pump while watching the stopwatch for joy. [Music] Tata was offering safety. Hyundai was offering premium-ness. And Maruti Swift stepped into the role of the cousin who is a bit mischievous but definitely listens to the elders. 2024 brings forth the fourth generation of the Swift, bidding farewell to four cylinders for even better fuel efficiency. Alliteration, I tell you. [Music] [Music] According to Maruti, the heart lineage has evolved. The whole car learns portion control without losing appetite because weight and emissions have been reduced. If the third gen was on a diet, then this one is on intermittent fasting. Maruti tried to inculcate a hint of grown-up vibe in this fourth-gen Swift which is nowhere close to luxury. But you can definitely call it smart simplicity. The manual love story is still alive because most buyers choose this trusted five-speed manual over the AMT. [Music] Because that is the core of the Swift. Small, shifty, nimble. The most fun is in driving the manual. Is it the fastest? No. Luxurious? No. But if a small car joy index were to be made, it would still score well. Because it still treats a U-turn like a dance move while putting up great fuel efficiency numbers. Am I happy about the three [Music] cylinders? No. This is definitely not something like the GRS. And honestly, Toyota has done madness with that car. But if you were expecting it to be like it, you have nobody else to blame but yourself. This is a fun, reliable, efficient, and fun-to-drive city car. Because Swift has proven that efficiency and fun [Music] can actually coexist. But it‚Äôs not a surprise that for it to happen, build quality has always had to take a back seat. [Music] 20 years ago, Swift taught India that sensible can be cool, and every generation has expressed this sentence in a different way. First swagger, then stamina, then diet, and now discipline. [Music] Is the Swift a perfect car? No, there are many ifs and buts. And the compromise in build quality is good for your pocket [Music] but enough to disturb your peace of mind. But every generation has given a lesson. Feel doesn‚Äôt just mean horsepower. Character doesn‚Äôt just mean badges [Music] and engineering doesn‚Äôt just mean specs. And if you can look at the bigger picture, you will see a truth that greatness is light. Sometimes in weight, sometimes in ego, and sometimes in fuel bills. Not all cars change big dreams. [Music] Some change small moments. Moments like an empty lane on the way to the office, a clean overtake, a late-night tea [Music] stop. And that‚Äôs the story of the Swift [Music]. Staying a little happy every day is the essence of this car. [Music] This was Past Forward with the Maruti Suzuki Swift. I am Utkarsh Negi. For more such videos, subscribe to Car 24. See you in the next one.

We are sharing a room, and tomorrow morning we will head out for the meetup. Nothing much else for now. You all should subscribe to Fuel Injector. I didn‚Äôt quite understand what he said, but it was nice interacting with him. 

I‚Äôve seen that people from Odisha are very friendly. [Thank you, thank you, thank you!] What‚Äôs your channel name? I watch 94. Okay, thank you! Everything is good. 

I just got a call from a friend, and he was on a video call. He showed me his subscriber count, and I was really happy. It feels great to know that I have a large fan base. People from Odisha follow those who create detailed and informative videos, and they appreciate what I do. 

So, I‚Äôm thinking of making a trip to Odisha someday. After this trip, I might announce a trip there. I‚Äôve been invited by many people in the comment section. It‚Äôs amazing how people are so welcoming. I feel like I‚Äôm living in India, but I don‚Äôt know much about Odisha. The real secrets of India are so beautiful, and I want to explore them. 

Now, we are heading to the first meetup for me. There have been two other meetups, but this is my first. I will be riding the TVS and Talk. I rode it last time as well, and I‚Äôm excited to see how it performs with JK tires. 

Let‚Äôs go! The meetup location is only 800 meters away, so I thought we could ride there. The sound of these bikes starting up is amazing. It feels exhilarating. 

The Speed Triple is running behind, and the sound is impressive. The JK tires are performing really well. I leaned into a turn, and the bike didn‚Äôt lose control at all; it held the grip nicely. Tires are very important because when you go on long trips, if your tires aren‚Äôt good, you won‚Äôt feel confident or enjoy the ride. 

The Pulsar F250 is a very capable motorcycle, especially for touring. I recently made a video about it, so you can check that out too. The meetup was crazy; many superbikes showed up, and it was a lot of fun to see them all. 

Now we are going to refuel the bikes. Right now, I‚Äôm riding the Pulsar F250 again. It‚Äôs a very capable motorcycle, great for touring. I thought fewer people would know us in Chennai, but many came to meet us, which was nice. 

There‚Äôs a bit of a language barrier, but it‚Äôs great to see that people understand and appreciate what we do. It was an amazing meetup. 

I think I‚Äôll end this video here because tomorrow we will start riding towards Vijayawada, which is about 470 km away. I‚Äôll be riding different bikes, so there will be separate videos for that where we will talk about each bike in detail. 

Let me know in the comments how you liked this video. Don‚Äôt forget to like, subscribe, and hit the bell icon. See you in the next video, and as always, ride hard, ride safe! Bye-bye!

As soon as we press the clutch, the car starts to feel heavy. It's always been my habit to lift the car a lot, but even then, the biggest issue is that the spare tire has stopped coming with the car. As soon as you reach 120, the steering starts to feel heavy. I'm going to file a complaint about this at the service center. How can there be so many issues right from the start? If you turn on the AC while driving in summer, the car struggles. Let me tell you about a scam where I was asked to scratch a coupon. Look at this seat cover; this is my original seat. And look at this, it's a joke. Hello team RNK, my name is Nitin. Friends, the car I have with me today is very special. It used to be India‚Äôs most favorite hatchback, the Swift. But since the new Swift came out, it hasn't received as much love as its previous version. What happened that the sales aren't as high as before? In today‚Äôs video, we will talk to the owner about their experience with this car, why they bought it, what has been good and bad, and whether their decision was right or wrong after driving it for a while. If you are thinking of buying a Swift and have any questions or queries, this video will answer all of them. Just make sure to watch it till the end, and before that, subscribe to the channel and like the video. This way, you won't waste your money and can buy a good car. Let's meet the lovely owner of this car. 

Hello friends. Welcome to RK Autos. How are you? I'm doing great. How about you? I'm good too. So, you have bought India‚Äôs most favorite hatchback. It used to be loved a lot, but now it‚Äôs not getting as much attention. There‚Äôs a lot to discuss. We will learn everything about it. First, I would like to start the video with your introduction. So, tell our lovely audience about yourself. 

As my brother mentioned, my name is Yash. I‚Äôm from Uttam Nagar, and I work in Gurgaon. My family is here, and I belong to Rajasthan. 

Okay, Yash. We will structure this video into five pieces of ownership so that everyone can know what they want. First, we will discuss the purchase experience. Second, we will talk about performance, engine, mileage, etc. Then we will look into practicality‚Äîwhether the features provided by the company are genuinely useful or if they could have offered something better. In the fourth part, we will discuss the pros and cons. Every car has its shortcomings, and it's good to mention them. Lastly, we will have personal feedback about whether the experience has been good or bad after buying this car. 

So, let‚Äôs start with the purchase story. Nowadays, SUVs are trending, both small and big. How did you decide to buy this car, and what was its competition? The main purpose was to go to work. 

Okay, so the distance to your office is quite a lot. It‚Äôs around 40 km one way. You must have heard of the Rapid Metro in Gurgaon, right? 

Yes, I have. It‚Äôs around 7 to 8 km from there. 

So, based on your daily budget, you found Swift to be a good option because of its average mileage. 

Yes, I chose this car thinking about the mileage. Other options like the Tiago and Hyundai i10 also provide good mileage. But we were crazy about the previous Swift. 

So, you thought you would get something good and new with this car. The interior and body have completely changed. The front and back are different. They have narrowed the space a bit inside. 

People say that Swift has always been inspired by the Mini Cooper. 

So, for you, this is your Mini Cooper! [laughter] 

So, how do people like it? 

It has caught attention. 

How is it in terms of looks? 

Looks-wise, it has become more attractive than before. 

Okay. We will discuss performance and pickup later. The average is still the same as before, and we will learn everything about that. 

So, Yash, tell the audience which variant you have, what fuel it uses, and how much it cost you on-road? 

I took the VXI variant in CNG. 

Oh, the VXI CNG, which is the base model of Swift in CNG. 

Yes, it starts from the base. 

What was the overall price? 

It cost me ‚Çπ8,58,952. 

You calculated it exactly. 

Yes, I made sure to mention every penny. The company gave some discounts, and now the GST has decreased. 

So, the discounts might have increased? 

Yes, they might have increased. 

Did you receive any coupons or anything? 

I received a scratch card coupon. I will tell you about it later. 

Accessories, etc.? 

Overall, it cost me around ‚Çπ45,000. 

You will tell us later if there is any scam involved? 

Yes, there was a small scam regarding the coupon. 

So, now let‚Äôs move to the second part, performance. 

It has cost me around ‚Çπ8,600. 

Now, regarding performance, because no matter what car it is, the engine is the heart and lungs of the vehicle. 

The biggest issue people mentioned was that this car has a three-cylinder engine instead of the previous four-cylinder engine. 

Yes, people criticized it a lot. Some even said they gave a plastic engine in this car. 

On paper, the company claims it has 100 Nm of torque and 60 BHP of power. 

But that‚Äôs not true. I have owned the previous Swift for two years and drove it a lot. 

In three months, I have already driven 11,000 km. 

That‚Äôs a lot! 

Yes, I have regular trips to Rajasthan, and the long-distance commute is significant. 

The previous Swift had a good braking system, but this one doesn‚Äôt have the same power. 

The braking system is okay, but the power is lacking. 

If you turn on the AC while driving in summer, the car struggles. 

If you go uphill or on an overpass, the car struggles. 

If four people sit together, the car will struggle. 

You have to shift down to second gear to get it moving. 

People say that at low RPM, it feels like the car isn‚Äôt even moving. 

I have complained about this to the service center, as it‚Äôs a new car. 

There shouldn‚Äôt be any issues in a new car, whether it‚Äôs electrical or wiring. 

The mirror adjustment is smooth, but the other one has a ticking sound. 

I will file a complaint at the service center about this issue. 

Now, regarding the engine, you mentioned a lot of vibrations. 

Let‚Äôs check it live. 

You opened the hood. 

Look at the vibrations; they are excessive. 

Is it running on petrol or CNG? 

It‚Äôs on CNG right now. 

Let‚Äôs switch to petrol. 

Okay, let‚Äôs switch to petrol. 

Now, let‚Äôs see how it performs. 

Okay, now it‚Äôs on petrol. 

How fast have you taken it? 

I touched 155 km/h on Dwarka Expressway. 

The previous Swift didn‚Äôt take as long to accelerate. 

This one feels like I‚Äôm pushing it hard. 

The performance isn‚Äôt as enjoyable. 

You need a car that feels good to drive. 

Forget about the old Swift‚Äôs pickup; you won‚Äôt find that here. 

In CNG, it feels like an e-rickshaw. 

So, you bought this car mainly for mileage, right? 

Yes, the company claims 20 to 22 km/kg on CNG and around 18 to 20 km/l on petrol. 

But you feel it gives around 26 to 27 km/kg on CNG? 

Yes, I have personally experienced it. 

I have to fill up in Rajasthan, and I still have fuel left. 

What about petrol mileage? 

I haven‚Äôt experienced it much, but I think it‚Äôs around 20+. 

Is there noise insulation in the cabin? 

There is a slight noise at low speeds and high speeds. 

What about the CNG tank? 

It‚Äôs a bit embarrassing; the design is odd. 

You have to find the right side at the CNG pump. 

It‚Äôs a strange design choice. 

How much CNG can it hold? 

It depends on the pressure, but I‚Äôve filled it with a maximum of 7 kg. 

What about the ground clearance? 

It‚Äôs 163 mm, which is quite low. 

Does it give you confidence while driving? 

Once you reach 120, the steering feels heavy, and you lose confidence. 

How is the braking experience? 

The braking is not good at all. 

It doesn‚Äôt give confidence at low speeds, and at high speeds, it‚Äôs even worse. 

Now, let‚Äôs move to the third part, practicality. 

The boot space is claimed to be 265 liters. 

What‚Äôs the reality? 

Let‚Äôs check it out. 

Safety hasn‚Äôt been prioritized at all. 

The spare tire is no longer included. 

There‚Äôs only a puncture kit, which is a one-time use. 

I can‚Äôt carry all the necessary equipment. 

The spare tire space is gone, and they could have designed it better. 

Have you seen the Tata ICNG? 

Yes, it has two cylinders and a spare tire. 

The boot space is a waste. 

It‚Äôs not sufficient for a family. 

The CNG tank is placed awkwardly. 

Let‚Äôs check the back seat. 

Is it a proper three-seater or just two plus one? 

It‚Äôs more like two plus one, as it‚Äôs not spacious. 

The suspension is soft, but it‚Äôs not comfortable. 

Now, let‚Äôs talk about the features. 

What are your favorite features? 

The AC controls are better than before. 

What feature do you wish it had? 

If the interior was a bit bigger, it would have been better. 

How is the gear shift and clutch performance? 

The clutch performance is good, but it makes a noise. 

I‚Äôve complained about it, but the problem persists. 

The windows have a lot of vibrations. 

This is a new car, and it shouldn‚Äôt be like this. 

When I turn on the AC, the car vibrates even more. 

If I drive with my family, the car struggles even more. 

After driving 11,000 km, what‚Äôs your overall experience? 

I feel like I didn‚Äôt get my money‚Äôs worth. 

I should have gone for a Tata Altros instead. 

If someone is looking for mileage, they can go for it. 

But if they want performance, they should avoid it. 

The Swift is good for daily commuting, but not for enthusiasts. 

Thank you for sharing your honest feedback. 

If you have any questions, feel free to ask in the comments. 

Let‚Äôs wrap up the video. Ride safe, drive safe. Thank you, Yash.
